page.title: 17SCHOOL PLAYTIME
page.content: The school at Walesby has a large grass and hard-core play area and the children play many games, one of the favourites played during break times is "British Bulldog". This game is play in a defined area, usually using the markings of a hockey or netball pitch. The person who is "on" stands in the middle of this area with the rest standing behind one of the lines at the end. The person in the middle calls out the name of one person at the end, this person then has to attempt to run to the opposite end of the court. If he/she succeeds in running to the end the rest of the group may follow. If the person called is caught and held whilst the caller shouts "British Bulldog" then they join the caller and another person is called.
